body: DO NOT FEED THIS TO YOUR DOG Let me start by saying that my dog has NEVER had a single issue with her digestion. She’s a low maintenance, mixed-breed rescue who has had diet changes with zero problem.I bought Blue Buffalo thinking it’s a premium food at a more reasonable price than her prior food. After refusing the bowl, which is abnormal for her, she ended up giving in and eating a serving. 36 hours later she was refusing to eat, had diarrhea, and woke up vomiting blood. I honestly wish I had taken a photo to show you the amount and the shocking bright red color of this. I rushed her to the emergency vet to be told that her GI tract was inflamed due to the food. After further testing, she also had blood in her stool. I paid over $400 to be told that a top selling dog food caused this.In reading into it further, there are DOZENS of accounts of the same things happening to dogs with no prior issues. If you think it’s safe to risk it, do yourself and your dog a favor and buy one of the other brands that actually care about canine health. Done with Blue Buffalo forever.

body: I can see my dogs health improving! I'm pretty cautious about what I feed to my dog. Up until about a month ago I was meal prepping her food about once a week and keeping it frozen until I needed it. Unfortunately, this is EXTREMELY time consuming and after some changes in our home life, I wasn't able to spend several hours at one time preparing everything. My roommate had picked up some dry kibble that they had gotten at Walmart and immediately I could see her itching EXCESSIVELY. I was worried that maybe somehow she had gotten fleas and would check her every time she would itch, but never saw any fleas or flea dirt. I also started to notice her licking her legs more, which is a self soothing gesture that dogs will do when they are uncomfortable. I suspected that her diet change was a huge part of what was going on and spent hours looking up reasonably priced HEALTHY dog foods. I learned that seeing "natural" on a labels is a marketing ploy and that there are all kinds of thing that shouldn't be given to a dog in there ( ex: palm oil ) and that you have to READ the ingredients.I switched to this dog food about 5 days ago (still mixing in with the old food abt 50%) and already I notice the difference. She doesn't immediately start to kick her leg up with you touch her back, I can tell that she is just more comfortable. Also, you can SEE the quality in the kibble. The old food I have is extremely dry and grainy feeling. This stuff looks fresh and my doggo loves it.

body: Do not buy Blue Buffalo dog or cat food I gave this 1 star only because you have to mark one. I did not do my research on this food beforehand thinking it sounds like a good food & expensive so must be good right? There are studies out there tho, vets do not recommend this food either. We had our dog & 2 cats on it. We believe it was the food that started our beagle bassets heart failure from a very small murmur that should not have amounted to anything. Our male siamese cat at the same time formed crystals in his urine, which yes can be common in males anyway. Obviously it's very hard to prove it's the food but in vets eyes when a lot of animals come in with these same problems & other problems & they are almost always on this food it is too big of a coincidence. I started telling people about it & we had a lot of friends say they already heard its not good food, they market it very well. I was heart broken to think a company that feeds our pets would rather put a crap ton of money into marketing it than making a healthy food. Always ask your vet what they recommend. Ours said Purina was next best after Science Diet.

body: My dog farts when I feed her this Bought this because the ingredients seemed good and got lots of recommendations. However, I researched this more and found that vets do not recommend Blue Buffalo because they used animal by-products in their food without listing it on their labels and claimed they had no knowledge that it was in there! Seems silly, but this can actually happen since Blue Buffalo doesn't own the plants where their food is made, unlike some other brands. Vets also claim they see a lot of gastroenteritis cases with pets on this diet.Now, I had already bought the bag so I figured I'd go ahead and feed her the rest of it and switch back to Hill's just to be safe. I wasn't expecting to see any difference in her. Shes very healthy and relatively young (5 years). So I didn't expect it when she started.. well farting.. A LOT. Not gonna kill her, but that coupled with my research has made up my mind. So, yes, I believe all the accusations this brand has gotten and I do not think this is the right choice for your pet.Purina, Iams, Hill's and Royal Cabin all own their own manufacturing plants. If that helps anyone in deciding who to trust, I'd start there.

body: 💩 🤮 💩  Icky taste, RUNNY POOPS  💩 🤮 💩 I bought into the marketing hype about how I'm a better dog mom for buying this food. My girl ate it over the course of 8-10 months. There were many times when I'd put it in her bowl and she'd look up at me as if to say, "Ugh, isn't there anything else?" This is a dog who will eat carrots, kale, rabbit poop, dog poop...so I know she's not picky. 😆  All the more reason to investigate when she doesn't like the taste of something.After keeping a poop journal ( because yes, I'm THAT dog mom and also poop tell us what's going on in the body) I realized that her poops were always progressively runny as the day went on. Every. Single. Day. We feed 3x a day and she poops about 3 or 4x per day. I always clean it up, so yeah...I notice the subtle changes in the consistency. The only poop that was 100% solid was the first one of the day. Then it would get softer and softer until it was so runny that we'd go on walks and I couldn't even bag it. Also, she's a long-haired breed, so THAT's been a joy to deal with. 🤮 🤮 🤮I switched to another brand...Wellness https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001BORBHO...and holy 💩, ALL of her poops are ALL NORMAL. She also loves the taste of her new food. I love being able to pick it up after it comes out the other end. I love that I don't have to wash her entire back end after an especially messy poop. I will never buy anything from Blue Buffalo again.

body: Beware of purchasing food and having it shipped I purchase Blue Buffalo for my animals all the time. I go to my local pet store to purchase. However, I thought at the time why not “subscribe and save” this would become a major error on my part. I received my package from Amazon and it was a box within a box. Firstly, nothing from Amazon comes undamaged these days. Nothing. The first box was opened. The second box was damaged. But the food looked unharmed. Wasn’t opened. Nothing. So I fed it to my three dogs, and my cat loves to steal their food if any is not eaten. By the very next day ALL FOUR. I repeat, ALL FOUR of my animals were sick. My dogs were pooping blood. Literally. My cat was vomiting and couldn’t even make it to the litter box. My dogs started to vomit and I had endless trips to the vet. Because their food had been messed with. I contacted customer service got a refund, ended my subscription.Thankfully my animals are all fine now but we will NEVER again purchase through the mail. So just beware and be cautious.

body: Good quality dog food..especially if your dog might be sensitive If it's in the budget doggie gets a decent brand of food.  There is at least one well regarded dog food review web site that also keeps track of recalls.  After a couple of disasters with pet food made in an unmentionable country or two I try to stick with well regarded brands that aren't made in those countries.  Many brands that used to be good have succumbed to the profit margin unfortunately.  Blue Buffalo consistently gets good reviews and as far as I know has never had a recall at least in recent history.  My dog apparently developed a sensitivity for chicken based dog food which is weird because he can eat fresh chicken with no ill effects meanwhile a chicken based dry food results in an explosively upset stomach (tired of cleaning that mess of puddles up off the floor kind of upset stomach).  My local stores have stopped stocking the big bags of this food which is the best value for the price so I order when I have to and amazon always comes through with the fastest arrival time to my door.  It's tough for me to wrangle a thirty pound bag of food out of the car anyway so shipping's probably the best for me anyway.  My dog seems to enjoy this and when the bag arrives at the front door it always gets wags and five minutes of insistent sniffing when it's taken out of the box.  They have several foods for sensitive metabolisms, apparently chicken sensitivity is common in dogs (if I had to guess I'd say all the junk we shoot chickens up with on the farms, hormones, etc.).  I've used this one and the salmon version he does great on both just the salmon is a bit higher priced.  Normally they say don't suddenly change your dog's diet but when the lamb can't be found he doesn't seem to have an issue going back and forth between this and the salmon.

body: Bad stomach problems For years, I fed my boxer-pitbull Science Diet dog food. Up until earlier this year I thought it was fine till I noticed he was avoiding the food. I read some reviews that suggested there had been a change in the food, which makes sense as I noticed the kibble shape had changedI decided to switch to a different brand and tried feeding a couple different flavors of Blue Buffalo to my buddy. Initially, he liked it much better than the Science Diet, but almost immediately he began to have really bad gas. It makes sense with a high protein diet, but it’s nearly constant. Additionally, we had a friend that fed his dog a high protein diet for the past several years and his dog now had cardiomyopathy, which had been related to high protein diets, even though it was marketed as “healthier” for dogs and more expensive.I finally decided to try switching again and picked Royal Canin, which came with good reviews from several sources. I’ve been splitting his food to transition him for the past several weeks, but placing each brand on opposite sides of the bowl. He immediately eats all of the Royal Canin and begrudgingly eats the Blue Buffalo. After reading several reviews about quality I decided I’m going to pitch the rest of this dog food. body: Why the exceptionally large / unaffordable price increase? I needed to purchase a high quality, healthy, weight maintenance dog food for our * year old Lab mix Daisy. She has ballooned to 116 pounds in June since I am no longer able to take her for long walks. With the weight gain she has become lethargic, sleeping all hours even during the day and has become uninterested in playing with any of her toys. In addition to her not getting enough exercise she is acting very depressed and I can relate it to first the loss of mybeloved Australian Sheppard "Dito" 6 months ago and 2 weeks later the death of my wonderful husband in May from COVID.  We all need to exercise and eat our way back to health. I talked to my vet and did my own research and found the Blue Buffalo Healthy Weight Life protection formula. The cost was out of my reach in our local grocery store so I checked here on Amazon. On August 1st I bought a 30 lb bag of the chicken and brown rice formula for $35.53. Daisy did not complain at all as I started to mix it gradually into her food. Feeding her 2 cups twice daily she started to lose weight without begging for scraps or treats so I assume she was satisfied. A visit in September to the vet had a weigh in of 101 pounds. Amazing. She was able to jump up on the bed, looking to play tug with her giant rope and had a little spirit again. The vet wants her at 80 pounds so we intend to keep her on this food. Due to the mixing with daisy's old food for the first 14 day, that bag lasted 7 weeks. I purchased another 30 lb bag on September 20 for $34.26. I was checking prices on Prime Day for many of the deals and decided to buy another bag before I ran out and was shocked to find the price "Starting at $54.88" for the same 30 lb bag and not available as prime. That is a $20.00 increase!! Why?? I will find it very difficult to spend that much and I do not want to switch her food when she is doing so well now. I hope this increase is temporary...please.

body: DO NOT BUY BLUE BUFFALO - IT IS DANGEROUS This is my first time to ever write a review on Amazon.  But buyers of this product should beware that you are risking the life and health of your dog.  I am giving this product a 1 because there is not a 0.  We purchased this product because there were so many good reviews on Amazon.  We have 3 golden retrievers.  The oldest, about 8 years old has suffered from Pancreatitis.  She has recovered and we selected this food because of its low fat content and reviews about helping dogs with digestive issues.  We have been making home made food for our dogs but with 3 it was just too much work.  We chose the healthy weight product for this dog and the Lamb and Rice for adult dogs for the other two.After one week on this food, our Golden Retriever started to wobble and seemed week in the back legs.  After 10 days she could not even walk!!!!!  I started doing research and there are LOTS of comments and reviews on Amazon and other sources about issues with this food, many of which are related with not begging able to walk.  I can not understand why a product with such pervasive issues can still be on the market.  Blue Buffalo should be removed form the shelves, because it is DANGEROUS for your animals.We have cancelled the subscription we set up, and will be working very hard to regain the health of our family pet.  I hope that this review helps protect other customers from this dangerous company and product.PLEASE DO NOT BUY ANY BLUE BUFFALO PRODUCTS.

body: Switched to a different type of food, but not mad at this one. So, my dog was fine eating this. He started on the puppy formula and progressed to adult formula. His poop was a little yellow and sometimes loose, so I switched him the BB's Limited Ingredient recipe that had lamb to see if that had an effect. I think chicken just isn't something his body handles in larger quantities (treats with chicken do not seem to impact him much), but that isn't the food's fault. Transferring to lamb basically instantly work for him. So, before you blame the brand, give either another protein a shot or try their grain-free or limited options. I try to keep my dog and a fairly monitored diet and preferred limited ingredient items. I did order this using Prime and as a one-time purchase. I do not advise buying food related items from a third party seller, but I have never had an issue with Prime items. The package arrive undamaged and no bug issues. Just make sure you check the bag and expiration before use because if food is exposed or outdated then of course you will see negative side effects. We keep this food in a storage tub in a room not exposed to sunlight, if that matters.

body: Give my dog diarrhea, blood in stool, rash I rarely go online to review products that I use or have used, but after the experience I had with Blue Buffalo Dog Food, specifically, Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Adult Dog Food – Natural Dry Dog Food for Adult Dogs – Fish and Brown Rice – 30 lb. Bag. I feel I must share this so other dog lovers can make an informed decision. In short, I say stay away from this dog food. My Goldendoodle, Prince, had been eating this dog food (in a beige, bleu, red bag) for two weeks. I started feeding my dog this food April 21st, then two weeks later he had severe diarrhea, with blood and mucus in his stool.  Then this week he develop a rash/yeast infection and started shaking from side to side. He's breathing pattern has change, the rashes on his chest and shoulder are so bad he can hardly lay down or sleep. He sits most of the time during the day and at night. It breaks my heart seeing him this way. He was also lethargic and slow moving all day long (this is an extremely active and fast moving dog, and slow movements is out of character for him). When you touched him, he would yelp in pain. We are at the vet right now couldn't wait to write this review. Shame on you Blue Buffalo with this hype about "holistic life protection" bull caca. I think it would be fair to compensate me my money back. Vet bills are no joke. Hoping he pulls through this nightmare.
subject: Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 6-lb

body: Good quality, don’t listen to the reviews...listen to your dog(s)!! I am not one to take the time to write a review. I generally find no quality in reading other people’s subjective take on this food. Really can a human be subjective when it comes to dog food? Isn’t the dog the only one that can be subjective? Okay so with that out of the way, I appreciate everyone’s negative feedback regarding this food. I understand that it does take time to write these things and put in the mental currency needed to write a good one. So now to my “objective” review of how my dogs seem to like this food. They all LOVE it. I have all three of my dogs on it - my oldest is an 11 yr old boxer with renal failure (she’s on prescription wet food, the Rx dry food is insanely expensive), another is a 6 yr old Boston Terrier that got to be a little chubby so I was looking for her to lose some weight (and with this food she has!) and the last little guy is my newest pup: he’s a 1.5 yr old Brussels Griffon that LOVES to eat everything! (And get loves to eat this food! I’ve had to buy him one of these weird bowls that look like a puzzle just to get him to slow down eating it.)I’ve never noticed any change in production quality, every bag that I’ve received has had a seemingly equal part of their “bits” or whatever they call them. I do mix this with a little bit of wet food for the two smaller pups and quite a bit for my medium-sized aging boxer.So to conclude, don’t listen to the reviews; listen to your dogs! My boxer has always had a sensitive stomach - in fact she was on sensitive stomach Rx dry food before the whole Renal failure hit - and she has not had a single reaction to this food.They have all been chowing down on this food for almost 8 months now I want to say. So yeah it’s Blue Buffalo, it’s quality, don’t let your own “dog-like precocious” feelings vicariously attach to the dog. Because as humans, it’s easy to see “what we want to see” in our dogs!
subject: Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 6-lb

body: FOUND DISINTEGRATING MOUSE IN FRESHLY OPENED BAG Feeling absolutely DISGUSTED.  For the past two years we have been feeding our dog, Cooper, Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food as we were told this was a high-quality food and good for Cooper as he has a mild case of IBS. The vet took stool samples and did not find any worms or other issues.  We were instructed to do chicken & rice for a few days to see if that helped.  It did - today was the first day to add some of his Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food back into his diet and as I was scooping out the kibble, I found TWO DEAD DISINTEGRATING RAT/MOUSE bodies in the kibble. body: I buy it, have no idea the claims are true, and unless you analyze it you can't prove it either! Used to buy this dog food at a local store but unbeknownst to me they were offering me an introductory price and didn't tell me. Suddenly after a year they suddenly jump the price on me almost $20! Or it might be because of the raise in minimum wage and stores are no longer absorbing those costs ... either way can't afford the retailer prices anymore so I found the Blue Buffalo here on Amazon. I find it funny that they offer you the review and ask you about taste oh, I didn't taste it! The dogs eat it but then again the dogs will eat any knock off garbage dog food that I buy as well. Side note Blue Buffalo is suffering a scandal right now that they were adding some kind of meal to their ingredients rather than their claim of real meat being the first ingredient. I don't believe even the high-end dog foods are adding real meat, even though they claim it's chicken beef pork fish I believe we're really getting the by products like lungs intestines cartilage etc. The real meat is going for human consumption at $7 a pound. How can they put real meat in this dog food along with the other binders and fillers process it all and then sell it for $2 a pound? It's like that fast food restaurant that claims 100% beef patties. Don't let that fool you 100% beef can still contain 30% fat, because fat is still considered beef,  part of the cow. They didn't claim 100% lean! There is always this sleight of hand advertising that will trick the mind into thinking you've got something you didn't get. I always get a good chuckle out of other reviews that claim their dog was poisoned by certain foods, or their dog will only eat certain foods , these are the same dogs who probably eat their own excrement and being a dog I guarantee they're licking themselves all over everywhere and probably the owners face as well, yet the owner wants to claim one dog food is better  than another?  Unless he  tasted it, ate it for some time and actually built muscle  and energy  and a shiny coat of hair on himself  I would have to contend  the owner  has no clue whether this dog foods is beneficial or not. So this is still just another high-priced dog food but I buy it so take that with a grain of salt.

body: New Dog Our sweet Jolene (Airedale Terrier) was going a day or two without eating.  We thought it was possibly because she was eating so much of her little humans' food off their plates, so maybe she just wasn't hungry.  Since it was time to move her from puppy to adult food, I did some research to find out what food was the best for her AND within our budget.  After finding an insanely good deal on Amazon, we went with Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula and my mind was blown.  Jolene is scarfing down her food within minutes at meal time, instead of leaving most of it in the bowl.  This morning, she whined for more (she had already gone 1/2 cup over her per meal time serving, so she didn't get it since we need her to maintain her health) and actually tried to pull and push my husband over to the closet where her food is kept.  I wouldn't have believed it if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes.  Needless to say, we're thrilled with our purchase and won't be cancelling our "subscribe & save" on this product.
subject: Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food, Chicken and Brown Rice 6-lb

body: Our Lab Loves It! We have a 95lb Lab who would pretty much eat anything we put in front of him! That said, he does seem like this food a lot! We switched him to Blue Buffalo from Diamond Naturals grain-free after reading about grain-free foods and their possible long term negative effects on a dog's heart.After switching, I noticed he started to put on some weight (in a good way) as he was always shall we say, athletic in his build. In addition, he had some skin irritations which we battled since he was a pup, and they mysteriously vanished about two months after we switched to Blue Buffalo. Could be a coincidence, but I'm inclined to think not.It's a bit more expensive than what we used to feed him, but he seems healthier and to me, that's worth every penny.
